title: ضَمِيرُ الْفَصْلِ
description: Learn about ضمير الفصل - the pronoun inserted between subject and predicate for emphasis and to prevent misreading the predicate as an adjective.

notes.title: What is ضمير الفصل?
content: ضَمِير الْفَصْل (the separating pronoun) is a pronoun inserted between الْمُبْتَدَأ (subject) and الْخَبَر (predicate) in a nominal sentence. It serves to separate and emphasize, preventing the predicate from being misread as an adjective.

It is called 'separating' because it فَصَلَ (separates) between subject and predicate. It matches the subject in person, number, and gender: هُوَ, هِيَ, هُمَا, هُمْ, هُنَّ, أَنْتَ, أَنَا, نَحْنُ, etc.
keyPoints: Prevents predicate from being read as adjective

examples.english: Zayd - he is - the scholar
Allah - He is - the Forgiving
Hind - she is - the virtuous one
You - you are - the truthful one

notes.title: Functions of ضمير الفصل
content: ضمير الفصل has three main functions: 1) التَّوْكِيد (emphasis): strengthening the statement, 2) الْفَصْل (separation): distinguishing خَبَر from صِفَة, 3) الْحَصْر (restriction): implying exclusivity.
Without the separating pronoun, زَيْدٌ الْعَالِمُ could mean 'Zayd the scholar' (adjective). With it, زَيْدٌ هُوَ الْعَالِمُ clearly means 'Zayd is the scholar' (predicate).

examples.english: Zayd the scholar (adjective - incomplete)
Zayd is the scholar (predicate - complete)
You were the Watcher (restriction)
Indeed You are the Knowing, Wise (emphasis)

notes.title: Conditions for ضمير الفصل
content: For a pronoun to be ضمير فصل, certain conditions must be met: 1) It must come between مُبْتَدَأ/خَبَر or their equivalents (اسم وخبر إنّ، اسم وخبر كان), 2) Both the preceding and following elements must be مَعْرِفَة (definite).
If the conditions aren't met, the pronoun is not فَصْل but rather تَوْكِيد (emphasis) or مُبْتَدَأ ثَانٍ (second subject). The pronoun must match what precedes in person, number, and gender.
keyPoints: Otherwise it's توكيد or مبتدأ ثان

examples.arabic: إِنَّ زَيْدًا هُوَ الْفَائِزُ (بين اسم إنّ وخبرها)
examples.english: Indeed Zayd is the winner (between ism and khabar of إنّ)

examples.arabic: كَانَ زَيْدٌ هُوَ الْمُجْتَهِدَ (بين اسم كان وخبرها)
examples.english: Zayd was the diligent one (between ism and khabar of كان)
Zayd he generous - INCORRECT (كريم is indefinite)
The two students are the successful ones (correct)

notes.title: Grammatical Analysis (الإعراب)
content: Grammarians differ on the i'rab of ضمير الفصل. The Basran view: it has no i'rab position (لَا مَحَلَّ لَهُ) - it is purely for separation. The Kufan view: it can be مُبْتَدَأ and what follows is its خَبَر.
The majority view (Basran) treats it as a particle-like element with no grammatical position. In analysis, we say: ضَمِير فَصْل لَا مَحَلَّ لَهُ مِنَ الإِعْرَاب.
keyPoints: Basran view: لَا مَحَلَّ لَهُ (no position)

examples.english: زَيْدٌ: subject, nominative

examples.arabic: هُوَ: ضَمِير فَصْل لَا مَحَلَّ لَهُ
examples.english: هُوَ: separating pronoun, no position
الْعَالِمُ: predicate, nominative

examples.arabic: إِنَّ زَيْدًا هُوَ الْفَائِزُ: هُوَ ضمير فصل
examples.english: إِنَّ زَيْدًا هُوَ الْفَائِزُ: هُوَ is separating pronoun

notes.title: Quranic Examples
content: ضمير الفصل is abundant in the Quran, particularly in verses about Allah's attributes. It adds emphasis and clarity to theological statements. Examples include: إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الْعَلِيمُ الْحَكِيمُ, وَأَنَّ اللهَ هُوَ التَّوَّابُ الرَّحِيمُ.
Recognizing ضمير الفصل is essential for proper Quranic tafsir and i'rab. Without understanding it, one might misparse sentences or miss the emphasis intended.

examples.english: Indeed, You are the Knowing, the Wise (2:32)
Indeed, He is the Accepting of repentance, Merciful (2:37)
You were the Observer over them (5:117)
And he was on the highest horizon (53:7) - different usage

notes.title: Difference from توكيد (Emphasis)
content: ضمير الفصل differs from ضمير التوكيد (emphatic pronoun): 1) ضمير الفصل comes between two definite nouns (مُبْتَدَأ/خَبَر), while توكيد directly follows what it emphasizes, 2) ضمير الفصل has no i'rab position, while توكيد follows the i'rab of the emphasized word.
Compare: زَيْدٌ هُوَ نَفْسُهُ جَاءَ (himself - توكيد) vs. زَيْدٌ هُوَ الْفَائِزُ (فصل). In the first, هُوَ نَفْسُهُ emphasizes زَيْد; in the second, هُوَ separates subject from predicate.

examples.english: Zayd is the scholar (separating pronoun)
Zayd himself came (emphatic)
Zayd himself came (emphatic after verb)
Indeed Zayd is he himself (both can combine)

exercises.prompt: زَيْدٌ هُوَ الْعَالِمُ - 'هُوَ' هُنَا يُسَمَّى: ضَمِيرَ _____
exercises.promptEn: زَيْدٌ هُوَ الْعَالِمُ - 'هُوَ' here is called: the _____ pronoun

exercises.prompt: ضَمِيرُ الْفَصْلِ يَفْصِلُ بَيْنَ الْمُبْتَدَأِ وَ_____
exercises.promptEn: The separating pronoun separates between the subject and _____

exercises.prompt: مِنْ وَظَائِفِ ضَمِيرِ الْفَصْلِ: التَّوْكِيدُ وَالْفَصْلُ وَ_____
exercises.promptEn: Among functions of ضمير الفصل: emphasis, separation, and _____

exercises.prompt: ضَمِيرُ الْفَصْلِ عِنْدَ الْبَصْرِيِّينَ _____ مِنَ الإِعْرَابِ
exercises.promptEn: The separating pronoun according to Basrans has no _____ in i'rab

exercises.prompt: شَرْطُ ضَمِيرِ الْفَصْلِ أَنْ يَقَعَ بَيْنَ _____ (معرفتين/نكرتين)
exercises.promptEn: The condition for ضمير الفصل is that it occurs between two _____ (definite/indefinite) nouns

exercises.prompt: إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الْعَلِيمُ الْحَكِيمُ - 'أَنْتَ' هُنَا ضَمِيرُ _____ لِأَنَّهُ بَيْنَ اسْمِ إِنَّ وَخَبَرِهَا
exercises.promptEn: إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الْعَلِيمُ الْحَكِيمُ - 'أَنْتَ' here is _____ because it's between ism and khabar of إنّ

exercises.answer: The separating pronoun (inserted between subject and predicate)
Has no grammatical position (said of ضمير الفصل)
Zayd is the scholar (with separating pronoun for emphasis)

exercises.prompt: The pronoun that separates subject from predicate to prevent confusion with an adjective
The function of ضمير الفصل that implies exclusivity
The Quranic verse 'Indeed You are the Knowing, the Wise' containing ضمير الفصل
